intro: Racosperma calanthum, commonly known as the pink wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces bright pink to red flowers in spikes. It is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Racosperma calanthum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native fauna.
